title: The best gp
body: I had an appointment with the doctor regarding myself and my son. He  really cares for his patients and very understanding. I felt really comfortable talking to him. He really know what his doing and how to handle his patients thank you so much for having a lovely dr like him and all the receptionist are absolutely fantastic I never want to leave this gp it really is the best.

title: Where has the professionalism gone?
body:
After waiting approximately 18 weeks for a 1st appointment, I was seen & advised I would be reviewed after 3 months. I eventually received an appointment at the 6 month stage for a date in mid January 2020. Then at the beginning of Jan 2020 I received a 2nd follow up appointment date for the end of June 2020. Being confused I rang to check only to be told the January date had been cancelled. I advised them I had not received any communication cancelling this appointment & asked for reasons for cancellation as the new date left me with a 12 month gap between 1st appointment & follow up review. I expressed my concerns that I thought this was unreasonable. After asking for notification in writing of cancelled appointment as reasons could not be given, I was assured I would receive notification by post.
I immediately contacted PALS to register my concerns & was promised a call back that same day to address my concerns after they had spoken to the relevant department. I am still waiting. with modern technology there are numerous ways for contacting people this has not happened. I do not think a 12 month wait is acceptable for a follow up appointment as it is effectively a 'New' 1st appointment due to time lapse between appointments. What is going on?

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: 5 Star Care & Service - SICD Replacement.
body:
Due to my problems with an existing implanted SICD defibrillator, my wife and myself attended a meeting with the team on 03.01.20. It was agreed that my existing unit should be replaced, and a date was set for the operation 08.01.20.

I would like to thank all the staff within the Cardiac Day Care Unit where I attended, and then had an overnight stay. From my arrival the staff were professional caring and supportive.

I would like to give a special thanks to the team for the service I received. From the assessment of the original problem, to clearly identifying the options that were available to me, and to the procedure itself. The service was speedy, caring, efficient, and so very reassuring being around these professional well organised people. Prior to being put to sleep in the theatre I remember everyone moving around with purpose, which reminded me of a well choreographed routine, and feeling quite humbled that all this equipment and these professional people were here to help me.

Many thanks to all.

Note.
The theatre suits used from the outpatient area are far more comfortable and modest, as opposed to the tie up at the back aprons.

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care
body:
Excellent GP care and support.
Hugely helpful and kind reception staff.
Restored my faith after the closure of the Essendon Road Surgery.

title: Ambulatory care
body: I spent the best part of yesterday in Ambulatory Care following a shock diagnosis of very high blood pressure. I was seen quickly, measurements were taken efficiently and ALL staff involved were kind and caring and took time to answer my questions, make me tea and find me food. I returned this morning for a follow up and thankfully my condition appears to be under control. I was unaware that this separate unit existed. It and all the staff involved are an asset to our hospital and town. Thank you again.

title: GLAD research study
body: Have been sent a text to participate in the GLAD research study but the link doesnt open. Trying to look for it just made me feel even more depressed and upset.

title: Great practice
body: Brilliant doctors surgery and nurses the nurse who done my daughter's needles was so kind and friendly thank you

title: Excellent Care and Advice
body:
Visited Dr with severe back pain. 
Excellent calm manner with outstanding practical advice. 
Referred to hospital without hesitation and am now in the right hands and hopefully fingers crossed on a road to recovery.
Thankyou

author: UHM29
title: Everything is as clean as possible
body: Ward 7 - I don’t think the food is very good, the staff are all nice, always busy in the ward, but always cheerful and helpful. The people that do the cleaning take a lot of care to make sure everything is as clean as possible. It would be lovely if everyone had single rooms as it can get noisy when there’s lot of visitors. The ventilation isn’t great, old windows/buildings don’t help.

title: Very unprofessional
body: Since my son took part in the attention and interaction group Nov/Dec 19 I kept calling to request his medical record from his S&L therapist. I always get a message that someone will call me back to discuss it with me and nobody ever does. The only way one can get a reply from them is by sending an official letter requesting their child’s medical records according to the Data Protection Act. In my case they have 15 more days to reply before I take things further. If you can, avoid the Acorn Centre!! Both my son’s Paeditrician and his S&L therapist have failed to spot what was wrong with my son. If you can afford and want to see some results in your child development, go privately. Otherwise, be prepared to have a lot of patience or take things further.

title: Excellent & efficient practice
body: I was given an appt with the practice the following day after visiting A&E at night. My doctor was very understanding & listened to my all concerns & arranged for me to have an urgent physio appt. I felt she interested in me  & the problems which I had that led to the A&E visit. I didn’t feel rushed - an excellent doctor

title: Midwife
body: I was induced to labour at 4am ,I had lovely midwife, unfortunately in the morning the midwife came and she was so rude to me and my husband,  after 4 hours I said the head is coming out and she didn't believe me and she didn't check it ,she said that as a first  time mum I will have contractions for another 12 h, after 30 min of me saying that the head is coming out my son started to loose the pulse, as an emergency 6 people jumped to my room, they had to cut me and it was very stressful!!! Very arrogant,  very rude and unprofessional

title: Great service!
body: Never have I walked into a hospital consultation room and felt comfortable, I was listened to and felt like what I was going through was a genuine feeling, after feeling like I was being dramatic. 5 star service from all staff. Will definitely recommend family and friends to use this hospital over any other! Definitely outstanding service given to patients.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Failure to make appointment
body:
On 14th January 2020 I repeatedly rang the surgery but got no answer.
As a 63 year old man with serious issues I needed an urgent appointment. 
As I could get no answer on the phone- I saw the surgeries website invited patients to make an appointment via this medium.
So I sent a message explaining I could not get through on the phone - so could they make me an appointment urgently for a serious chest infection and extremely high blood pressure and that I was 63 years of age.
I.got a response to my website message Immediately.
It was quite arrogant and commanded me not to use the website medium to book appointments and I must ring up.
I tried the phone without success a few more times .
So I then messaged back to explain I could get no answer on the phone and that  I needed an urgent appointment as an elderly patient wIth serious problems.
I got no reply.
I then had no alternative but to ring another surgery and explain my predicament. 
They understood, registered me with their surgery immediately and msde me an appointment. 
I will let the reader of these Facts draw their own conclusions as to.the degree of seriousness of this matter.

title: Excellent Practice
body: Absolutely fantastic practice. Clinical staff are amazing. Also loving the MyGP app. I can book appointments at 8am in the morning when they are released without being in the queue for reception. I can also order my prescription this way. Really easy to use and frees the phone lines up for those that really need.

title: Caring staff
body: Every member staff, whatever their role, could not do enough to help, care for and encourage me. Absolutely everyone was helpful and kind. They went above and beyond their roles.

title: Nearly impossible to get an appointment
body: I was on the phone this morning at 8 am on the dot when the practice opened to book an appointment with a particular GP. I was relieved to hear that I was only fifth in the queue, as I have not been able to get an appointment recently, they were always booked up when I phoned, and they would not let me book an appointment. When my turn came, the phone line went dead at their end. I had no choice but to call back, I phoned back immediately, only a few minutes past 8, unfortunately this put me at 33 in the queue. When I finally got through, I was told that all the appointments with the particular GP I wanted to see were booked up, that I would have to see a different GP or a nurse. I purposefully called today, at 8 am sharp in order to get that particular appointment, through no fault of my own, it was the practice's phone line, I was unable to get my appointment. In the time it took me to explain this situation, all of the other appointment slots with other practitioners were booked up, and now I am left stranded with nothing but tears. This place has lost its compassion and humanity. I have been a patient at this practice for almost ten years. It used to be fairly straightforward to get an appointment, and get the help my family and I needed. This has drastically changed in the recent years. We can no longer make appointments ahead of time, and it is virtually impossible to see a particular GP, which is very difficult for patients who feel more comfortable seeing particular health professionals. Asking to make an appointment with a particular person should not be too much to ask for, it never used to be. It is very easy to see how people fall though the cracks of this system, especially when they are at their most vulnerable and at their weakest.

title: Efficiency
body: Admitted myself to A&E with severe upper abdo pain. Staff nurse in A and E was very kind. No hesitation in giving me strong IV pain relief. Had a stone removed from my gall bladder the next day. No waiting for an operation. Extremely pleased, recovered well. So very grateful for this excellent, professional service.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Super quick!
body:
I attended the breast clinic after a referral from my GP. Although the clinic aims to give you your first appointment within two weeks of your referral, I was seen in one, and as I arrived early for my appointment, I was seen 30 minutes early. I have never experienced a negative waiting time at a hospital before!
All the staff - from the receptionist, to the nurse who explained what would happen during my appointment, to the consultant who saw me - were very friendly and made sure I was comfortable and had an opportunity to ask any questions. The team at this clinic are exceptional and made this experience one of the best I have had with the NHS. Thank you!

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Cattle market
body: Not liking the new system of no advanced appointments. You either have to queue b4 8am, or try and ring. When I last rang it took 87 calls b4 my call was answered, my daughter 134 times. The practise obviously has too many patients. I much preferred the old system. Advance appointments, or ring on the morning, or 1pm. Queuing outside a doctors how degrading is that!?!

title: Ridiculous
body: No appointments till february have just been advised. Typical of this surgery. No regard for patients

title: Very clean and professional
body: I went in for a full hysterectomy and found that even though it was busy ( i was warned they may have to cancel beforehand so i was prepared)and i had to wait in recovery for a bed, the nurse that looked after me there was an angel! She went out of her way to make sure i was ok , even putting an electric fan out for me after i was too hot post op! I found most of the staff very positive and caring in a very busy environment . Considering the strain the NHS is under at the moment they do a stunning job and i was dead impressed with their attitude. The surgical team were also amazing!!( Charlies Angels!!) Explaining every procedure to me in detail and very caring and attentive! I am very grateful thank you derriford! I also found it very clean with cleaners constantly wiping surfaces. Given the strain on staff and resources in the NHS a very positive attitude considering!

title: Practice has gone down hill
body:
I've been a patient for nearly 30 years. The last year trying to get anyone to answer the phone is frustrating at the least.
I've had an ongoing issue for 3 months.
You seem to spend time repeating what's wrong with you and why your back and wasting limited time that patients have. Just tried to make another appointment as it's still eight days until my next one to reveal another blood test due on the 20th to be told that the results may not be back in time?? I  stated that your practice manager had booked it and wanted to cancel my appointment. This practice has to start looking after its patients and stop taking on more.

title: Family
body: My father in law has quite a lot of health issues, probably due to his age, but the way his GP has dealt with caring for him regularly is exceptional

title: Great clinical care, shame about the admin staff
body: I, more often than not, receive excellent clinical care from the medical and nursing staff. However, the receptionists are another matter. They are brusque, rude and high-handed, acting as obstacles to care rather than facilitators. When I declined to give a reason for my appointment request I was told “I’m a receptionist, I see all your records anyway, so it’s not confidential from me”. Now while in reality this might be true, I don’t believe this to be in the spirit of GDPR or the Practice Values. I maintain that I wish to discuss my clinical care with a clinician and will decline to be , in effect, triaged by non-clinical, unregulated staff. If this is indeed the direction that the practice or their Commissioners want to move in, this needs to be explicit on the website, and some guidance for patients about the governance surrounding this.

title: Thorough
body: After a problem with my skin persisted Dr has consulted a dermatologist. Friendly and helpful advice.

title: Terrible
body: Some staff members shouted at residents and was belittling them. Would not let them watch what they wanted on tv and was watching a very violent film that the residents didnt want to watch, i had to leave from visiting my father in law as i had my child with me and the movie was VERY inappropriate. Some staff were also arguing amongst them selves and talking about other staff, i was gob smacked and my husband is currently looking for him to be moved asap

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Great practice
body: Have needed dermatology since September got appointment every 4 weeks for treatment. Very friendly staff. They do an exceptional job.

author: Sydd
title: The Recovery College is Life Changing
body:
The Recovery College is life changing, not just for me but for the whole family. My wife, children, my grandchildren, everyone has noticed the change in me. I’ve been able to give information to close family about mental health and they have been encouraged by it. They can’t believe the change in me. I’m happier and contented and lovable. I used to hate everybody and now I can talk to people and tell them anything, and I know they will listen and not judge me. I won’t be ashamed to tell them. By doing this I think I’ve tried to break down this stigma about mental health.  
My physical health has improved and in the last year my whole aspect of my life has changed. Before I went to the Recovery College, I was terrified of change but now I realise change is necessary for recovery. I’ve changed 100%.  
There are people out there to look after and help you. I’ve now got the coping skills and strategy to help me with my life. I’ve met people from all walks of life. You are at the Recovery College to recover whoever you are.  
I did 22 courses and graduated from the college in December 2019 and now I’m going to become a volunteer to help others and give them the chance that I’ve had. Mindfulness and journalling courses were unbelievable, if you are in the moment you are looking at yourself and not at others focusing on yourself. Giving yourself a chance to look at your life and look what lies ahead.  
I can’t thank them enough. The encouragement and love shown to me by all staff and volunteers opened up my life again.

title: Speedy
body: My appointment was for 11.30am I arrived at 11.05am and was on my way home  by 11.25am. Very nice people polite and informative.

title: In-patient care
body: Having very recently spent time as an in-patient at the Hospital, I can honestly say that the level of care I received was absolutely first class. It didn't matter what their role, whether Housekeeper, HCA, Nurse, Doctor etc, all of them performed their allotted tasks, skillfully, compassionately and showed great empathy and care. There maybe faults within the system but the staff, whatever their race, colour or creed, are outstanding.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: great practice and service
body: very good practice -- every one very helpful and very friendly --goods service ... great doctors --i will recommend this surgery to every one.

title: Ultrasound review
body:
I got to the practice early and on time. I was greeted by the gentleman who performed the ultrasound with a handshake and a smile. He reassured me that it would be quite soon to start the procedure. While in the room, I was asked to remove my tops , sitting down . I was asked for my name and date of birth. Nothing was mentioned about which part of my body would have the ultrasound. As the gentleman, who was assisted by a nurse, was about to start, I pointed out gently that he was about to start on the wrong shoulder. Quickly he went about it professionally. The procedure lasted only a few minutes. I then asked the gentleman if he saw anything of a concern, he replied yes and gave me a brief description and told me the results would be sent to my GP within a week.
The whole experience was pleasant and professional.

title: Impressed
body: Arrived 5 minutes early was seen exactly on time and the ultra sound was over within 5 minutes .The only down side to the clinic was the lack of parking I had to drive round the adjacent streets to find a parking space.The service was very good and no. Complaints on that side

title: Terrible
body: Without getting into detail with my experience. I've had continuous trouble with the staff at the practice, receptionists and Dr's. Reception has a terrible and rude service. In regards to Dr's, they didn't take my problems seriously and didn't follow anything up, which lead me to changing surgeries. I am now sorting the problem with referrals to the hospital.

title: really really poor service
body: tried to book appointment online but theres absolutely no slot available, called the phone line and stayed on the wait for 45 minutes  with someone saying i was number one on the waiting list, tried to select all the options aswell as select option to discuss test result still no one answered, pretty shocking to know if i receive a sti test result text message asking me to call back to discuss further no one will answer the phone. I have seen a lot of review talking about same issues so clearly staff at the clinic are not bothered about their patients.

title: Disturbingly Inefficient
body:
Text recieved to make an appointment for test results.  No physical appointments but 3+ weeks wait for a telephone call.  
If you want to join - Don't. 
If you can - Leave.

title: Great practice
body:
Its a great surgery, doctors are excellent and do a great job in looking after the patients. They go the extra mile.
The reception staff, busy as they are continue to provide excellent service to patients and a staff member in reception is great in communication and getting back to the patient with regards to any queries.

title: Not acceptable
body: I have been ringing for the last two days to get a same day appointment. After 25+min on hold both days of course there were none. I was told to book one online which involved setting up the online service. Next appointment 2 weeks. I need to see my GP now. Reception advised I go to Walk In Centre, where I would be already if appropriate. This is not a WIC problem as it will require ongoing care. After 20+yr with this once fantastic practice I am no longer able to recommend it.

title: Lovely staff & great services
body: Yesterday I had a colonoscopy performed at St Mary's which I was very nervous about. All the staff made me feel completely at ease and were very friendly and reassuring. They explained everything very clearly to me and I felt completely at ease in their hands. The prep and post-care was amazing. From the consultant to all the nurses, I can't recommend the endoscopy department enough. Thank you so much St Mary's!

title: Excellent care
body: I attended A&E with my son. They staff were efficient and really great with him. Was seen very quickly. The physio practitioner was excellent. The nhs gets so much stick but I was so impressed with how professional they are. Thank you

author: Franc G
title: Appointment Rescheduled -without telling me!!
body:
Arrived for out patient appointment at New Victoria this week, I had also received a text a few days earlier reminding me of forthcoming appointment, and cost to NHS of failing to attend.  
On arrival I was advised that my appointment had been rescheduled, and a letter had been sent advising of this (the day before I received the text), this has still not been received.  
I was verbally advised I had originally been booked into the wrong clinic, and would now have to wait over 5 weeks for ‘new’ appointment.  
Very unsatisfactory, and also stressful, particularly as anxious to get procedure carried out

readBy.name: Office of the Chief Inspector, Healthcare Environment Inspectorate

title: Response to X-ray taken
body:
Hello 
I recently had an X-ray taken by Male Practitioner and I think clearer advice would be good before X-ray about clothing.
As I had to have my X-ray twice as a label of something I was wearing showed up on X-ray.
Also I felt abit uncomfortable having to rearrange my clothing in room.
Better advice before going in would be really helpful.
Thanks

title: Caring and thoughtful nurses
body: I recently attended Heartlands Hospital during a deeply worrying time whilst pregnant.  Unfortunately I was having a miscarriage.  The care I received on Aspen ward from the nurses was faultless.  They were kind, caring and compassionate.  The experience itself was very upsetting, but I will always remember how wonderfully compassionate and empathetic the nurses were.  Sometimes its the smallest gestures that really mean the most.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very difficult appointment policy
body: For booking a new appointment the only available date is Monday every week and via phone. It means that it’s very hard to get connected, long waits over the phone and, if you miss that, the only possibility to book an appointment is the following Monday to live it all again. It’s messy, not flexible and very upsetting. I feel terribly frustrated with this surgery.

title: Reassuring
body: Dr has helped my son immensely, he finds her very reassuring, she listens to him and gives advice accordingly.  My son comes away feeling positive and confident.

author: Agnmr37
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Group Feedback Session- Day Service
body:
Care Opinion Group Session 6th December 2019  
We (Engagement & Experience Facilitators from SHSC NHS FT) have been invited to the St Georges EatingDisorder Day Service. We met with a group of service users and talked about theirexperiences and thoughts of the service.  
The service users who tookpart in the session talked about different activities they attend at the DayService. Although all the sessions were found to be helpful some more enjoyablethan others.  
The activity that seems to be the most popular is theRelaxation group which recently has been moved from Tuesdays to Fridays. Thischange in the activity schedule was seen as particularly beneficial, especiallythat it was no longer followed by a CBT workshop. The other two sessions thatwere perceived as enjoyable were the Creative group and Cooking group. Theparticipants told us the Creative group involved a variety of activities whichhelped break-up the more intense sessions. The Cooking group allows serviceusers to make their own suggestions of the meals they would like to prepare andstaff are very supportive.  
A couple of sessions were seen as both enjoyable andhelpful. These were the Motivation group and Nutrition group.  
The helpful, more intense and less pleasant courses were; CBT,Body Image, Relationships and Meal planning.  
CBT was described as repetitive and not always helpful,although it was also recognised that it might just be that it isn’t suitablefor everyone. The other three sessions, although seen as less enjoyable, help toput things in perspective and the participants felt supported and understood bystaff. The group agreed that although some workshops might be more intense thanothers there is a reason why they are on the programme and they are veryhelpful and needed in recovery.  
During group sessions the participants felt that staffalways checked in on individuals and that they were always made to feel thatyou were able to pull a staff member aside for some individual time if youdidn’t want to talk during the group sessions.  
The Recovery App was found to be really quick and easy touse. One participant felt it was more useful at the start but as they had beenpart of the service for a longer time they used it less, another found thatthey were still finding it really useful even though they had been part of theservice for approximately the same amount of time.  
Although the whole service was described as extremelyhelpful and not needing much improvement, there were a few things that werementioned as ‘could be better or different’. Some group members felt that themeal planning could be done on a one-to-one basis rather than in a groupsetting. Though there was an understanding that some time was already given tothis is key working sessions if you wanted it.  
The two main things that stood out as needing improvementwere a bigger kitchen and another toilet to be available. The smallness of the kitchen meant that atbusy times you all feel squashed in there together and it can be quite anxietyprovoking and that the small table can feel overwhelming when busy.  
Overall the Day Service was described as a really goodstarting point and helpful for their recovery. The staff were seen as very supportive andunderstanding. All the service users felt that they were involved in decisionmaking and that they had a final word on their length of stay.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: Emmrd63
title: Keen and committed Independent Mental Health Advocacy
body: Thank you Lucy for your continued efforts and support since you have been in post, I have to say its lovely working with someone so keen and committed

title: Wonderful Staff
body: I spent two days in the Acute Care Unit and four days in the Cardiac Care Unit suffering from a suspected heart attack. I cannot praise too highly the clinical and nursing stall who treated me. Everything was explained to me clearly and great care was taken at every stage. The hospital is a shining example of all that is best about our NHS.

title: Great Practice
body: I brought my eight year old daughter in today to see the doctor. The doctor was great with her. She explained things clearly, did not patronise her or just talk to me, and even asked at the end if she had any other questions. I was really impressed. My daughter had been quite nervous about seeing a doctor, but after her very positive experience today i think she will be much less anxious for the next time we have to visit. Thank you!

author: ProgressNotPerfection
title: Success Story
body:
I was feeling incredibly low, sometimes it crying was the only thing I could do to express the way I was feeling.  
The way I was feeling was because of several factors. I was having a hard time at work and I would be crying before I went and after I left, feeling like I was just posing as someone who was good at their job and also being told by management that my department was failing because of one aspect of my role which I found incredibly hard.  
I also had issues with the way I looked and my weight, feeling like I was not good enough and that I did not deserve to be liked. I felt like most people could not see past my weight and could not see that I was a kind, generous person at heart and that my weight does not define me.  
I started my mental health care sessions whist at my lowest point, it has changed my life and I wish I had done it sooner. My therapist made me feel like I was the one in control and made me see my worth.  
I am now able to challenge my thoughts so I do not think the worst is going to happen, I am starting to see my positive attributes and I am also taking more time for myself.  
I could not of wished for a better outcome, everyone I know says I have changed, I have a more positive outlook on life and I feel like I can finally live my life without being scared of what might happen in the future.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: The Box Man
title: Catheter Ablation
body:
Thought I would write in and commend the work of Dr Robinson, the EP who led the team which carried out a catheter ablation procedure in January. Whatever the short, medium or long term outcome of the treatment my experience both in the ward and EP theatre was very positive indeed.  
I felt that everybody that I met had time for me and treated me with respect and understanding. Everybody seemed to have some time, in a very busy day, for pleasantries and humour. At no point did I feel that I was simply a number on somebody's list. I was treated as a human being. Long live the NHS and all who sail in her - if you know what I mean! Please inform Dr Robinson that my pulse is strong and stable, even if I'm not!  
[Very happy with 'Seeing the whole me']

author: Anrol
title: He was a little star as always...
body:
My grandson ( age 8 ) attended the day surgery department at Crosshouse hospital today. He was really nervous and so was his mum. From the minute we entered the department we where greeted by helpful, friendly faces and treated with kindness.  
Even though it was a busy morning, with lots of kids, the staff were excellent. They introduced themselves to my grandson and keep us informed about what was going to happen throughout the stay.  
All went well, he was a little star as always and we got him home before lunch time today.  
I would like to say a big thank you to all of the team in the children's Day surgery department, you do a wonderful job.

author: Overjoyed Mum of 3
title: Homebirth was one of the most magical experiences
body: I was expecting my 3rd child and wanted to have a homebirth. I was put into care of the fife Homebirth team who oversaw all of my care throughout my pregnancy. The service I received was amazing. The 3 midwives Paula, Frances and Katrina were incredible. They supported me through the pregnancy and were always available to answer any questions in an open and friendly way. They each made a point of getting to know me and my family so that I was comfortable with homebirth process and while in labour. It was an amazing experience and the homebirth was one of the most magical experience of motherhood. I would particularly like to thank Paula for all that she did to make this a wonderful journey for me and my husband and family. I cannot advocate this service highly enough and am so grateful to the team for their support as is my daughter!

title: Unprofessional
body: First of all they cancelled an appointment of mine today with no reason and they don’t even know themselves why they did it so they had to move me to another doctor today. On top of that two reception members were constantly messing about with each other play fighting with each other, sitting on the other ones lap and being very flirty with each other. It’s just looks so unprofessional and when I came back for my appointment later in the morning they were still doing it. It’s unprofessional and looks really distasteful

title: Dr call back
body:
Great explanation about the  test result I had before Christmas . 

Extremely happy .with the service provided by the GP

title: AMAZING
body: this is the first time i’ve actually been pleased with a doctor before!! The doctor I saw told me some very important  information which had been found out for almost a year and nobody had told me until now, i’ve been trying to find a cause of a pain i have since i was younger and i am only now being told what it was after seeing many doctors and it turns out it was on the system the whole time!! thank you so much for the care and attention she gave. i really appreciate it and next time i see paediatrics i’m going to ask for this doctor.

author: Natyc68
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Its made a difference
body:
I contacted the service after I had unfortunately been bereaved by suicide. I felt I could open up and tell them exactly how I had been feeling, I didnt know what to expect to be honest but I have to say its been the best thing I have done contacting SBIS, they put me in touch with a local 1-1 therapy.  
After having the therapy just a few times I started to feel I could cope that little bit more than I was. SBIS offered me a follow up call to see how I had been getting on a few months after out initial contact to which I said "I am bearing up ok"  
I would definitely recommend this service if they have been affected by suicide.  
I must added that I really appreciated the follow up call just to see how I am getting on and made to feel I can call back anytime if I feel I need support in the future.

title: Couldn’t ask for more
body:
Having never been ill for most of my 28 years, last year left me with 3 major health issues that came all at once. I first saw one GP as the only available appointment and from my first appointment with him he provided me consistency, care, reassurance. He became my regular GP and had supported me through a difficult year. He seemed to genuinely care, from reading all my notes before my first appointment to keeping up to speed with how things were going by reviewing my records before my next appointment. He has chased things up for me, he made me feel listened to, at each contact has done a holistic assessment and considered everything, not just looking at one small thing when they could all be related. Even when running late or a late evening appointment I felt I was given the time to talk through things/deal with my issue, not feeling rushed or an inconvenience. 
Having never had any health issues (other than the odd childhood thing when younger), I genuinely feel so happy that I had such a positive experience and truly feel that this is what a GP should be like. 
I can not thank him enough and the care I have been shown, even when my health issues may be a drop in the ocean to what some people may be going through, is next level and I have been listened to and felt my overall well being had been considered and put at the forefront.
My last appt he was running 40 mins late due to no fault of his own but was not made to feel rushed or an inconvenience and was in around 20 minutes, I made a comment about trying to be quick so he wasn’t late home to his family but he said it didn’t matter as his patients need his care. 
He’s approachable, professional, caring and passionate. Excellent communication skills. The other practice staff such as secretaries have also been great and kept me informed when they have chased or made referrals on his behalf. I can not recommend the practice enough and want to thank this GP who is now my named GP having dealt with me for the past year. The NHS is taken for granted, and being a nurse myself I know the strain and pressure it’s under, however this has not influenced the care I’ve received. Thank you Elmwood

title: Great comfort
body: Since I have got hearing aids from Hidden Hearing in Barnstaple, clearly I have realized that my NHS ones had been much unclear. My husband noticed the difference immediately he has been much happier.  I tried playing piano with both, it also made a big difference to me, I am pleased to have better hearing aids now. I didn't like the microphone sound when I was in a car otherwise all seems fine. Thank you.

author: Gaulty
title: Made to feel at ease
body: A attended the city a few months ago for a check on my prostate gland. The nurses all made you feel at ease prior to seeing Mr Khan. This man is such a gentleman and to say he makes you feel at ease is a understatement. I have since had a MRI and this will be followed by a TP biopsy. Even the warmth of the words in the letter I received this morning make you feel at ease. Thanks for everything.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: suspected brain cancer patient treated apallingly
body:
my sister is currently on Ward C7, arrived by ambulance and given scan showing lesions on brain.  told definitely cancer early morning Monday (13 jan) and frightened. then told possibly not cancer by another doctor.  assured needed further scans to find a potential primary source of cancer and would be done by midweek. 
nobody has been able to tell her when the scan will happen, she's on a ward with elderly patients who don't sleep and frankly look appalling.  she can't sleep because of noisy patients and nurses talking loudly at night next to her bed.
she's a mother of 2 young children in a highly respected job and is being treated like she is worthless.
she has spoken to a sister and is aware of the procedure of PALS and keeps asking to speak to a matron or doctor but she is patronised and ignored.
I rang the PALS number on her behalf and got a voicemail - we will see if anyone call her but I doubt it.
This hospital is awful and all staff involved in my sister's care should hang their heads in shame.  She is frightened anxious and nobody will help her.  Horrible place and horrible people

title: Great experience
body: I was very impressed with the whole experience at Spa Medica...the speed with which I got an appointment and had the procedure carried out was amazing. All the staff were very efficient and friendly. I am so happy with the outcome as I can now see without glasses for the first time in 50 years!

title: Excellent service
body:
All investigations complete with minimal delays. Staff re-arranged to shorten visit. Painless scans and camera investigation. (Superb camera!!)
Intelligent helpful staff answered all questions.

title: APALLING
body: Had been in great pain for 3 weeks. Was on painkillers prescribed by GP, however the pains worsened and spread. Went to Chase Farm urgent care centre. There wasn't a doctor in attendance but a triage nurse. Was there for 2 hours, others were there longer without having been seen. We saw the nurse put his jacket on and leave. My husband decided to take me to Barnet A&E. It was crowded, there was nowhere to sit. Waited at the queue for reception for 15 or so minutes. It wasn't moving. Was in terrible pain I had to leave and go home. A few days later worsened more. My son came and took me to University College hospital. What a contrast. Within 2 hours was seen by a qualified doctor, checked, x-rayed and prescribed stronger painkillers. This has been a great help. I am now able to walk around the house and no longer have to rely on my husband to lift me in and out of bed or a chair and to bring my food upstairs. Since approx. 20th December my GP had referred me to a muscular/skeletal specialist. Chase Farm wanted me to go to back class! I need to be scanned to see what has happened to me. I was a fit and healthy person. The state of emergency services run by Royal Free health authority is terrible. It is badly run and management is atrocious. A&E's are understaffed. The staff do their best if you ever manage to see them but they are in an impossible situation. Perhaps the health authority can take lessons from the properly run west end hospitals who are and always excellent.

title: Non-NHS services
body: Appointment for 11:00am for a medical test to renew my professional drivers permit. I logged in at the surgery and a message said appointments are running 31 minutes late!!! I had to pay £150 for this service. Is compensation offered? I think not:( Other surgery prices were around £110. Maybe changing surgery could have been a better offer. In addition I had a blood test a few weeks ago and advised the results would be available when I visit the surgery on a certain date. I did so and was advised not all the results were ready!!! Was asked to make appointment to speak with the GP. When you have to work many, long hours every day to pay bill's and you're struggling to do so, I would expect the surgery to honour their own instructions and not have to unnecessarily have me lose income over their lack of organisation. And I'm still waiting for the medical!!!!!

author: Thank heavens for friends
title: Difficulty finding information on website
body:
Tried to find out online where dermatology is, where we could get parked nearby, where there would be wheelchairs available, where there were disabled parking spaces. we found it impossible, and we know the hospital and it’s lay out. Fortunately I know someone who works there who advised us to park at the rehab hub. This was easy, there were wheelchairs at the door, dermatology was nearby and the whole process of getting in and out was easy, a huge stress relief compared with previous visits to the community hospital. The doctor, dr Sinclair was terrific, with wonderful clinical and communication skills.  
So it was one of the easiest hospital visits we have had in Forth Valley,and we have lots.but , without the advice of our friend, it would have been awful. We feel you need to improve your web site and make arrival and departure from the hospitals less stressful.  
Thank you to all.

title: Kind, understanding staff
body: I found a lump in my breast just before Christmas and was referred to Solihull breast clinic on a two week emergency appointment. I was booked in by a phone call on the day before my appointment on 7 Jan 2020. I was naturally extremely apprehensive on my arrival at the hospital but was met with continuously kind understanding. From the volunteer who showed me where I had to go, to the brilliant doctor, each talked to me as though for that moment they actually cared about me - which is such a comforting feeling when you are in such a frightening situation. The difference was that each person I went to, the lovely lady who did my mammogram and the lady that was training in the ultra sound section all took their time and chatted to me as if they knew me. Despite being extremely professional they were very personable too which made me relax and feel safe. The whole service overall is fantastic, being able to have all of the checks and the results in one visit is so much less stressful than having to await further appointments. I was lucky, mine was a cyst - which the very efficient and lovely doctor drained with a single sharp scratch. So I would like to thank each and every person who was involved in my care.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great sensitive and careful doctors, nurses and…
body:
I was with this clinic for 3 years and have found both the medical and non medical staff exceptional. They have never been dismissive and are always thorough and understanding. I believe that the clinic builds this environment as I have had the same experience with all the different doctors I've seen. It is the combination of careful listening and genuine belief in the patient that led to a diagnosis of an issue that I have had for years, which I came in to discuss hesitantly. 

With other, more common issues, the doctors and nurses have always been caring and firm in the handling of the situation. I have never been put in an uncomfortable position, and have always had things explained to me where needed, including my medication. None of my visits have felt rushed. 

I have also had phone consultations to discuss test results and these were efficient.

author: KIW
title: truly appreciated by both me and my family.
body:
I ended up unexpectedly being in hospital for 10 nights. The atmosphere from nurses and doctors was first class. The over riding impression was that they were all extremely helpful, caring and friendly; they could not do enough to help. Many thanks, that was truly appreciated by both me and my family.  
I am coeliac and lactose intolerant. There was a menu to choose from, and the breakfast girl sent for gluten free bread, toasted it and brought it freshly to me every morning. Excellent, thanks. On New Years Day only sandwiches were delivered but the nursing staff arranged for me to get a salad from the staff canteen, much obliged.  
Contact with the doctors (especially Amanda) was very accessible, so very helpful to me and my son.  
To call out a few specific names; Kathleen charge nurse, Lesley staff nurse, Ashley nurse who washed my hair at night. All fab.  
The cleanliness of the ward could not be faulted. The open visiting is ideal.  
I wanted to write to say a huge thanks to everyone on the ward.

author: fellow
title: They did not answer the nurse call buzzers
body:
i had the misfortune of staying in ward 1 at hairmyres recently.  
the staff were rude and did not answer the nurse call buzzers and when they did they acted like I had done something wrong. there seemed to be a clear lack of team work and respect among the staff. they forced me to wake up and get washed at 6am!  
they acted like there the entitled and its shocking. i spoke with a student nurse who said that it was the worst placement they had ever been on and that the ward has this reputation  
i sincerely hope i never have to step foot in that ward ever again.!

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: wallstreet
title: the most amazing nurses
body:
if you need good care and pleasant staff then Hairmyres outpatients is the place to get it. Every member of staff i came across was amazingly friendly and helpful. caring and polite. you could see genuine friendships among the staff.  
the department itself though the waiting areas are cramped and messy not well layed out at all some seats are not easily accessible.  
the new reception is 100x better than the old one apart from the fact cables are visible and hanging from the back of the desks

title: Great Practice
body: Attend at the A&E after having visual disturbance  and bad headaches which was subsiding.  After explaining problem to reception, was in the Triage within 5 mins. Short while after I had blood samples taken. Next saw a duty Doctor who gave me a thorugh examination. Then on for a Cat Scan, which found the problem. The Doctor gave me enough time to discuss the problem. As no urgent need for treatment, referred onto Walton neurological. Very impressed with the speed and efficiency of all the staff. Their manniorism was very professional and at the same time friendly putting me at my ease. They are a credit to the Hospital.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent care
body: Having had a neck gland removed by the surgeon a year ago, I attended a second scan and review today.  The care by all members of the ENT team before, during and after the operation were excellent and I would have no hesitation in receiving further treatment in this department. Thank you.

title: Nice experience
body: I want to just say how great the male health care assistant was today in taking my blood as the First Lady couldn’t find a vein. Both were amazing and very professional. Please pass on my thanks. From Linda Hood

title: Great nurse
body: She is nice and polite and respectful with other she does her job well i got hep b injection i usually scare from.nidle but she does the job properly

author: runningmy95
title: Good care
body: Turned up a hour late for a hospital appt with Dr Sabroe and he and his registrar (a) saw me (b) were so kind and warm (c) were nice to other staff. Really good experience. it was a physical health appt however my psychological well-being was so carefully considered too which I really appreciated.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Terrible
body: This is a terrible service. I was not notified about my results (which was over a year ago) and cannot find any contact details regarding how to obtain my results. Shocking service and very poor patient care.

readBy.name: Central and North West London Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

author: Survivor at Brambles
title: Stroke rehab
body:
I am emailing you with a compliment relating to the work of the Early Supported Discharge for Stroke South West Surry team who looked after me from January until the middle of March following my stroke in November 2019.  
  
The Early Supported Discharge Team were also invaluable in my continued progress to normality. Without the physiotherapist and occupational therapists, I would not be able to do everything I can today, which includes making progress towards the level of fitness I was at before the stroke. I set myself a target of running 3 ½ miles and they both encouraged me and enabled me to believe it was possible. So far, I have got to 1 mile.  
The staff in hospital do an amazing job, but it is so important to be able to get home as that is where one’s recovery in set in the real-world context. Therefore, I would like to state that this service must continue to be offered for all stroke patients for whom it is relevant.  
  
Please ensure that my compliments are shared with the appropriate people in the Trust as I know how important this is. All too often Trusts receive complaints, but compliments are so important for the continuation of a really good service.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Self-Referral Physiotherapy
body: Good service, easy to book. I was seen on time for each appointment and the treatment/advice was explained well to me.

title: Applause to reception team
body: Applause to the reception and I think supervisor for working to juggle very demanding challenges and remain efficient and courteous.You are appreciated and make more difference hthan you might realize when a patient is strugging to cope witha difficult situatiin. Thank you

author: Beryfitt
title: Head and shoulder injury
body:
At 0400 hrs in the early hours of the morning in August 2018, I experienced a traumatic fall down the stairs, taking the stair gate with me and crashing into our front door. I can remember nothing of the incident and only gained consciousness whilst being wheeled along a corridor at the A & E Department of Gloucestershire Royal Hospital. Fortunately, my husband had called 999 when he found me and the ambulance had arrived pretty swiftly and taken me into hospital.  
Fortunately I was discharged from hospital shortly after 0900 hrs but with 3 staples in my head, a broken right collar bone, fractured left ribs and severe bruising.  
Although I have no memory of the incident, my husband said how well I was looked after by the paramedics who attended me so promptly after he had called 999.  
Also the subsequent care given me by GRH when I saw a Trauma Consultant was excellent.  
I have now fully recovered and am very thankful for the care I was given by the NHS.

readBy.name: Plymouth University Urgent and Emergency Care Bsc (2020)
South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body: Good web site, easy to use. I  order my repeat medications online and collect a few of days later. I have great confidence in this medical practice.

title: Easy, accessible, friendly practice.
body: Joined this practice in November 2019 and it's been a really positive experience.  The reception staff are approachable, professional and friendly and the online service option is great!! Saves time for me and also the GPs and Nurses to focus on seeing those who most need it.  I've felt really cared for by my new GP.  Thank you everyone.  Why didn't I join you earlier??!!!!

title: Great ward
body:
My father was admitted to Sapphire ward on 18/12c& stayed for2 weeks. The ward was bright, clean,  friendly and cheerful .
Every single member of staff that we encountered , was knowledgeable, professional, friendly and caring . My father recieved great nursing care and I was kept up to date with his situation.

author: plutomy75
title: Just a very good service
body:
Just had a chap out from WestMARC to look at my wheelchair and it was excellent.  
A very nice chap, very helpful, very polite, just a very good service. We've always been lucky enough to have this excellent service.  
I'm always a believer that you'd be quick enough to complain if something was wrong, but theres as few people who would mention if it was good, so you can pass this on to the chap thanks.

author: Rich17
title: Told to go to local Pharmacy who would check me over
body:
Suffered from symptoms of tonsilitis through the night so called for a GP appointment at 830am. Told by reception staff to go to local Pharmacy who would check me over and decide if I needed an appointment.  
Pharmacy didn't open until 9am so I got out of bed and walked down only to be told that Pharmacy don't have the equipment to do this. They were perplexed as to why I'd been asked to go down and called the practice. The receptionists said I would need to phone back so I did and was told they had no appointments left.  
They were questioning why I needed a same day appointment even though I had already explained the symptoms (have experienced tonsilitis a number of times before) on the original call and the second one.  
Eventually I was passed onto a nurse practitioner who offered me a 1030am appointment. Very disappointed that I had to go out twice in the cold/wet for a process that doesn't exist.  
I didn't find the telephone manner helpful at all and didn't feel like I was believed by the reception staff. The pharmacy staff and nurse practitioner were friendly and helpful.

title: Kind, caring and respectful
body: A brilliant practice, all very kind and caring staff who treat their patients with dignity and respect. Thank You :-)

title: St Mary’s Sexual Health Clinic
body:
I rung up to arrange an appointment as I have minor symptoms. As I am currently NFA, they refused to see me and referred me to the local A&E which is an inappropriate referral.

Having then spoken to 111, the local A&E department and walk-in. centres, I rung back to confirm I did need an urgent appointment. They again, refused to see me. I pointed that I’m away for 4 weeks, and will be continuing to be sexual active. They then threatened legal action, that the phone call was recorded and criminal charges would be brought against me if I had sex knowing I have an STI. I then pointed out I don’t know if I have an STI, it could be a UTI or anything and the reason I don’t know is because they are refusing me treatment.

As an NHS employee this has been horrendous service from start to finish, would never wish this upon any patient.

title: Children’s Outpatients
body: Visited this hospital for food challenges with my daughter on several occasions. The staff in children’s outpatients are so lovely my 3 year old daughter always asks to see them when we visit any doctor. The hospital is small but it’s clean, friendly and has a great little cafe that caters for allergies too.

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: S69
title: I can see why the centre would be a benefit
body:
I finally attended the Centre in January after waiting six months for an appointment. I understand due to the work the centre does they are extremely busy and demand for appointments is high.  
I saw one of the Doctors and was warmly greeted with a smile. I was immediately made to feel at ease by the female doctor. Our chat was informal but she took a very detailed description of my medical history, symptoms and medication. My Gastro consultant had mentioned I had a problem with nausea so the goal was to try and sort this.  
After we had discussed my symptoms and agreed that the Pancreas problem I had was causing a few of my problems including me struggling to eat the doctor gave me two options available at the centre. One was Homeopathic treatment for the nausea to be taken once a day or I could attend as a day patient for a course to learn breathing, relaxation and coping strategies to deal with my situation. I decided to try the Homeopathic route even though there was no guarantee it would work.  
I explained to the doctor that I would prefer it if my consultant could figure out what my problem was and then deal with it and then I may not have the symptoms anymore. The doctor seemed happy enough with my reason for not accepting the invitation to do the. course.  
Another reason I didn't chose the course was I had previously spent four months under the care of a Chinese doctor undertaking acupuncture and Chinese medicine.  
On the suggestion of my Gastro consultant last year I started practicing meditation. Whilst my visit to the centre only saw me getting a possible solution to the nausea I can see why the centre would be a benefit to others with more complex problems.

author: S411
title: Treatment I received at my minor operation
body: Was extremely happy with my treatment today from Pamela, jennifer and Lairyann. I was taken within 5 minutes of arriving and taken to a room where the procedure was being carried out and they explained everything about my operation fully. I felt at ease and everyone was lovely and friendly.

author: Crohns battle
title: Crohns Disease Care
body: I was diagnosed with Crohns Disease in September 2018, this came as a shock and was very difficult to deal with. I have to say the IBD team at the RAH were excellent with myself and always answered what I consider an invaluable email service promptly and efficiently.   The care they have gave me has led to me being in remission for the past 9 months and being able to get on with my day to day life. They are an excellent team of nurses and I thank them for their care.

title: Uncaring unhelpful no empathy
body:
Over two years of going to my gp regarding heavy painful prolonged periods,  coil and contraceptive useless , finally referred to gynaecologist,  small fibroid found , several PAINFUL procedures followed and I was PROMISED  if my symptoms where the same after fibroid is removed then I could have the hysterectomy I was fighting for . So six months after the removal under a GA I went to see the gynaecologist again already highly emotional due to severe PMS I was asked what the problem was !!! how hard is it to read my notes so I began re explaining through my tears and this dr sits there blank faced clearly not caring and says what is it you want I say the hysterectomy I was promised she said no there is no funding and suggestedi try the coil again this absolutely floored me ! I unfortunately got very cross and said dont you dare do this to me   please please please help me she repeated there was no funding and that the consultant may be able to request funding but it was high unlikely,  I did swear and storm out which is very unlike me but I was distraught I mean I felt like I was screaming underwater , I've cried constantly since this appointment it's a disgraceful way to treat a woma in pain 
I dont have £5000 to g private so i guess I'm expected to suffer

readBy.name: Southport and Ormskirk Hospital NHS Trust

title: Can’t fault it
body:
Don’t usually bother with reviews but I am very impressed with my recent visits! The doctor I have been seeing has been extremely thorough, helpful and no matter how silly I sound asking some questions always happy to answer (without making me feel daft). The doctor is usually running on time and if he isn’t, the reception staff have let me know on arrival. The waiting area is clean and tidy and there are lots of posters/information leaflets. 
Most of the receptionist’s I’ve encountered have been more than accommodating for me and are generally seen smiling and warming/welcoming to the surgery although they are no doubt under lots of pressure. The health assistant was also very helpful when I attended when I had my annual check up! 
5 stars for such a fantastic service!

title: Exellent practice
body: I've been with this practice since 1981 when we moved to Oxford. It has cared for our family through many illnesses, the birth of two children and most recently, the birth of our first grandchild. The service and support is amazing, from the GPs, nurses, midwives and reception staff. The triage system for appointments means we have never failed to get an urgent appointment when necessary. The nurse practitioners and resident pharmacist are knowledgeable and kind. I find it hard to recognise the practice in some of the negative comments here as we think you are brilliant. Thank you

author: Proud of nhs
title: Nursing staff kept us laughing and easing any fears
body: I attended for small procedure. Received excellent care by friendly experienced knowledgeable nursing staff. Diane & Margaret kept us laughing and easing any fears we had. Also sadly watched as the expertly handled patients who spoke to them very aggressively and appeared disgruntled at having to wait with such a calm and understanding manner. They and all the other staff within the ward are a credit to the nhs. Nothing seemed to much of a bother for the hard working busy staff.

author: Mummygrandma
title: Adrenal insufficiency
body:
Adrenal insufficiency and a dangerous management scenario that happened to me.  
I use Liothyronine for central hypothyroidism (TSH deficiency 2004).  
I became adrenal insufficient and saw a consultant at Newcastle RVI in April 2018. I’d been on Prednisolone whilst waiting to see this doctor since December 2017. They swapped me to hydrocortisone and weaned me to zero for SST. I became acutely hypothyroid (clinically and biochemically). Liothyronine requires cortisol.  
I’d emailed this consultant a few times during the wean to ask if I was “safe”. They assured me I was. It made me very ill. I feel I was experimented on and my history of TSH deficiency should have sounded alarm bells for him to realise that my ACTH had failed too. I failed my SST. I’m now under the care of a doctor who I feel is more knowledgable.  
I have copies of results and photographic evidence of the induced acute hypothyroidism. I sent a comment to a senior member of ADSHG who sent my details to a clinical negligence lawyer. I did not give my consent for my details to be shared. Moreover, litigation is not my intent. I’d like my first consultant to be informed of their what feels like their error.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: cepheusfp94
title: Taking Warfarin up to and beyond pace maker being fitted
body:
Patient at 84 with a complex medical history was advised by letter to continue taking warfarin up to and past the day they had the pace maker changed.  
This has lead to extensive bleeding following the operation. The patient was discharged home with a cannula in situ as the bleeding would not have stopped.  
There has been extensive bleeding through the patients body. They have been re admitted and there is a debate to re site the pace maker as the whole area is infected. The patient is now on morphine, and having to spend two weeks extra in hospital. How much has this cost the NHS?  
Patients are routinely taken off warfarin even for dental work, really not sure why this patient was not taken off when a pacemaker was being refitted??  
I feel that this is negligence and lessons need to be learned.

title: All round good experience
body:
Having moved into the area 5 months ago the family and I have been struck by the high standard of all the practice’s services we’ve used. It’s such a contrast with previous experience in the county - reception staff are efficient and pleasant to deal with, appointments can be made easily and quite quickly in our experience, the attached pharmacy is efficient and again the staff are knowledgable and pleasant and finally the clinical staff are great. The Docs treat you personably but professionaly and respectfully and seem to make every effort to consider your issue with care (rather than appear to simply work thru a generic process).
It’s great to no longer be barked at by reception or assumed to be a little stupid by clinicians.
